Posted By: count_dorku (7/13/2011 3:57:24 PM)
Rating:

Such a perfect utility card, I wish the art were better. This is the ugliest man-land since Zoetic Cavern (if that even counts). If only they could've used Jung Park's really gorgeous Island art for this card.

@drakattak: Yes.

@Kidromeo: Sure, a land creature can be equipped like any other creature. When it ceases to be a creature, it ceases to be equipped as a "state-based action" (basically, that means you can't respond to the un-equipping with spells or abilities, it just happens). If the land is made into a creature again during your next turn, the equipment will remain unequipped, but you can pay to re-equip it each turn. (I've done this with a Loxodon Warhammer and a Nantuko Monastery, because a 7/4 Insect Monk with first strike, lifelink, and trample is about as awesome as it gets.)
Report Abuse

posts.post_content:
@Ladnurad  
I feel where you are coming from. But you have to understand that's just the nature of the game. Especially when a lead designer has openly explained how much he likes the poison mechanic. It's also why we will never see [Leeches](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leeches) again. Not because removing poison counters has been thoroughly explored in the design process but simply he refuses to allow it. The closest we will get is [Melira](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Melira). He also loves the power/toughness switching cards (see [Inside Out](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inside Out)) but luckily, as much as he pushes them, they aren't catching on.

posts.post_content:
I don't see how infect is just treated like any other brand-name ability, giving its respective creature a mana cost increase of 1, or even 0, when it's a completely game-changing ability. I don't understand why something that gives TWICE as much PERMANENT damage to players, and wither counters to creatures costs as much on a creature as haste or flying.  
  
Let's look at double strike. Granted, it gives the first strike ability plus regular damage, but in terms of player damage, it is essentially the same as infect (except that it's not permanent). Double strike typically increases the cost of a creature by 2x its power, and is extremely rare and very carefully balanced when given to creatures. Now let's look at infect. It's given to every creature left and right, common or rare, big or small, like a cheap wh0re dishing out blowjobs. When dealt to a player, infect deals PERMANENT damage, and essentially deals double the damage, along with the wither 'side-effect'... for the very pricey a... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

I don't understand why something that gives TWICE as much PERMANENT damage to players, and wither counters to creatures costs as much on a creature as haste or flying.

Let's look at double strike. Granted, it gives the first strike ability plus regular damage, but in terms of player damage, it is essentially the same as infect (except that it's not permanent). Double strike typically increases the cost of a creature by 2x its power, and is extremely rare and very carefully balanced when given to creatures. Now let's look at infect. It's given to every creature left and right, common or rare, big or small, like a cheap wh0re dishing out blowjobs. When dealt to a player, infect deals PERMANENT damage, and essentially deals double the damage, along with the wither 'side-effect'... for the very pricey a... (see all)

This card is crazy. This is arguably better than [Mishra's Factory](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mishra's Factory), [Jackal Pup](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jackal Pup), and any number of animated lands/one turn drops. Absorb that for a second.
